website_summaries.verdict: Home workout equipment supports exercises from push-ups, pull-ups, sit-ups, and dips to numerous core and abdominal exercises.
pros: Crunches and other ab workouts are easy using the padded grips for hands or feet
cons: Does not fold for storage, and tops out at 250 lb
Need approximately 90" of ceiling clearance to accommodate a person's frame for pull-ups

website_summaries.verdict: A basic, no-frills piece of equipment to get you started on your fitness journey.
pros: Supports push-ups, pull-ups, sit-ups, triceps dips, and more
Good for basic dips and pull-ups
Tough steel frame for solid support
Freestanding design.Measures 50" W x 81.5" H x 41.5" D.  Weighs 54 lb
cons: Not  a good choice for kicking  pull-ups or any other front-to-back motions

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this off of the great reviews but was surprised how flimsy this felt-- I only weigh 155 and the station rocks back and forth. It doesn't feel solid at all. While this is very affordable, I'd recommend buying a more substantial station like the Weider (which I used to own and wish I had bought now). And like everyone else-- the box showed up like it had been through a war zone but everything inside was amazingly ok.
customer_reviews.author: DLosangeles

customer_reviews.title: Beats door units by a landslide
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty lightweight for what it does. Although the box and instructions advised it to be carried and assembled by two people I did both by myself. It took me about 104 minutes to assemble. Mine rests on carpet fine although instructions recommend a mat. Its very sturdy. I'm about 170 lbs. I've done weighted dips and plyometric pull ups and this thing stayed put. Pushup and situp pads work great too. The best bang for buck that can be found for home pullups/dips. Only negative is if you are going to move it you'll have to disassemble to get it out of the door.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy Muscle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, and rock solid.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, and rock solid. I'm a ~200 lb male and I've been using this daily for the past 2-3 months since I bought this thing. It arrived in good condition, was pretty easy to assemble, and is rock solid. It's light enough that I can move it around to make the most of my limited space depending on the workout I'm doing. And it's got a large enough footprint that it's plenty stable while doing pullups, dips, etc. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: RunBikeSwim2013

customer_reviews.title: I like this exercise tower but it may be too short ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this exercise tower but it may be too short for taller individuals. I primarily purchased this item for the pull-up bar but the tower is almost too short for pull-ups. I am 5'7" so a taller individual may feel uncomfortable when they do pull-ups. However, the height of the item allows it to fit in my basement.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel X.

customer_reviews.title: Great In-Home System That I Actually Use
customer_reviews.text: Having this system in my home has enabled me to gradually build the muscle strength necessary for chin-ups and pull-ups. It was easy to assemble, and has proven over the past year to be stable and well built. My only complaint is that the main vertical bars angle slightly inward (I assume for added stability), which crowds the pull-up bar space between them. I'm still able to do great wide-grip pull ups, but basic pull-ups can feel a little cramped. Overall, though, I'm very glad I bought this system and would buy it again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Cox

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's definitely a good product. I weigh 220lbs and I can do pullups no issue with it. It wobbles a tiny bit, watch the video. If you don't know how to do proper pullups, then yeah it'll shake like hell. The worst for me is dips. It wobbles a lot for dips. Other than that, it's a high 3 star/low 4 star. But price makes it a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Silidons

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband and then helped him install it and it is not difficult at all. The only problem is that it is not very high, he is taller than I am, about 5'9, and his hands touch right on the bar. However he managed to get around it by just bending his knees when doing his pull ups. It definitely no problem for me I am 5'5 and I have to jump up to hold the bar. I do not recommend putting this anywhere near your legs if your sitting down while assembling it since it caught my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Stephany

customer_reviews.title: Overall Really Satified & this is Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This Stamina 1690 Power Tower is really Sturdy - actually Sturdier than I thought it would be. It is made of solid tubular steel. With 24 Hour Fitness shut down indefinitely from this past Monday, finally got this out of the box & assembled (ordered it Feb 20, 2019), knew it would come in handy when I least expected. Hopefully doing parallel bar dips on this, will keep my bench press strength doing 225 lbs for at least 8 reps. Also will dp pullups on this. I am really satisfied with the Stamina 1690 Power Tower!!!
customer_reviews.author: quikfeat

customer_reviews.title: Use it all the time, good deal
customer_reviews.text: Pulls ups and dips are so good for you, and I love using this. Great price, you can do some important exercises with this and it stores easily in front of my car in the garage. There are times when I wish it was slightly more stable, it will move slightly, but not enough to affect my workout. Makes me focus and make sure my movements are steady. Can’t complain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall, its pretty good for the price. It's sturdy enough for me (I'm 6'2 and 240 lbs). It wiggles very slightly when rigorously moving but not enough to cause concern. I use it on carpet so it might do better on something more firm like concrete. It's not the easiest to set up. The included tools are barely able to get the job done, I would suggest not relying on them. It did not come with instructions, but I was able to find them online. The biggest problem was that it was missing pieces for assembly, but the manufacturer was able to ship me the parts I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, not load bearning.
customer_reviews.text: It was straightforward to assemble. It's not sturdy and doesn't bear well when i do pull ups. Feels cheaply made. It rocks side to side. Pretty useless. Wish i purchased something that's a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Balaji

customer_reviews.title: Already broken parts
customer_reviews.text: Took about 2 hours to assemble. The back spacer piece already broke from tightening the screws before I even used the product.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: PErfect
customer_reviews.text: My son is in high school and assembled this by himself in about an hour. It's great for pull-ups. I weigh 210 lbs. There was no rocking at all while I did pull-ups. It was very sturdy. My back workouts are about to go to the next level!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: High quality, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I assembled it by myself, so not a lot of strength necessary! Came with all the necessary parts. I love having this in my garage and I don't even need a lot of extra space to be able to use it. The range of motion this gives me for chin-ups and other calisthenics is really helpful, as I hadn't had that ever before. Very stable built, and if a bolt comes loose, as expected, it's very easy to tighten again Also a very reasonable value product. It was competitive value, is very high quality metal, and met my needs perfectly. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Brian Williams

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: no complaints. My husbands doesn't like it as much as I do. He says its because the bars are too small for his hands. He also likes to keep his legs in front of him when doing chip ups. It's not his favorite machine. I have no issues with it. It stays in place, the bars aren't too far apart for my 5 ft 4 frame. Great for floor work and tubing too. Very Versatile. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L.

customer_reviews.title: Great value buy for a cost effective workout
customer_reviews.text: No problems here. This works just as expected. Pull ups and dips. I am 180 6’1 and I have no issues. If you are rocking this thing left and right it means you aren’t doing pull ups or dips controlled enough. Slow and steady controlled motion is what builds muscles don’t swing your whole body to do a pull up. You will tip this thing over and you won’t build any muscle. All you need to look good is go for a run and use this maybe develop your core enough to do toe taps to the bar for pros
customer_reviews.author: Yesake Teshome

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tower
customer_reviews.text: I weigh around 150lb at 5'7" and this tower feels very stable. The hand grips are of good quality so there is no strain/pinching on the palms when using this. I specifically wanted a tower without a back rest because I wanted more freedom of movement to try out dips and pullups at different angles. The dip bars are about 21" apart which is perfect for my frame and there is no strain on the shoulders. I was able to put this together in under an hour without any assistance and only using the tools included (If you have your own tools it should be much easier). A quality product overall. Definitely recommended for the home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Vivek S

customer_reviews.title: Missing Prop 65 Warning
customer_reviews.text: When researching this product I did not see the prop 65 cancer warning. The warning did not show up until I was on the final 'complete purchase' page. I couldn't keep myself from clicking buy. As it shipped I re-checked the product page and it did not have the prop 65 warning visible anywhere. I tried to cancel the order but it was too late and the product arrived. My room filled up with a pain causing sensation and I had to ship the product back at a $20 shipping expense. Hopefully I do get my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Patella

customer_reviews.title: Bolts and nuts are not threaded properly.
customer_reviews.text: Bolts and nuts are not threaded properly. I can’t put on two of the base bolts because the nut and bolt threads down line up properly. These are two important bolts that give the entire tower stability. Not safe to use. Please send me new bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Roger F.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective, and good value.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and fairly easy to set up with a ratchet. My previous 'power tower' was huge, expensive, and heavy. This lightweight version does move a bit more with use, but I like to think that trains me to complete steady repetitions. I use this in a small apartment and find it easy to move around when I need it out of the way. I wholeheartedly endorse any tower over something that will destroy your doorframe, and this particular version does the job well, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was easy, however be aware to assemble it relative to ...
customer_reviews.text: Just started using it, exactly what I was looking for, a free standing Pull up bar. Assembly was easy, however be aware to assemble it relative to where you want to place it, you will find fully assembled it will not fit through standard door entrances, requiring minor disassembly/reassembly. A little higher than I expected but I still have the correct amount of space to do proper pull ups and chin ups, the added push up, crunches, tricep dip functionality are perks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: one of most stasifying purchases ever
customer_reviews.text: I used to go to gym for work out but after I moved house it is a little bit far away. So I decided to buy this power tower one year ago. It turns out it is nice to have an equipment near your hand and you can use it every day. For this specific product, I really like its design--there is no welding part and all parts are single metal tube, so I will never worry about it might break down because of bad welding. Though it does not look as fancy as other products with a frame, but it has all basic function like pull up and push-up. That's good enough for me at least.
customer_reviews.author: Zheyi

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for the price. I am 5'8" and 140lbs, and it is very stable for me. One thing is that I am focusing very hard on having good form when doing pull-ups, dips, etc, (absolutely no kipping) so that, I'm sure, helps. It is true that the non-padded portion of the pull-up bar, where the legs connect, is right about where a comfortable shoulder-width grip would be, and I have been doing pull-ups gripping this part. Not great, but it's ok. I have attached rings to the pull-up bar and that works great too. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: The best indoor pull-up bar I have used by far. In my opinion, the doorway pull-up bars have nothing on this one. Gives you at least an additional 6 inches of height and stretch as compared to the doorway bars (depending upon just how high your doorway is). Love the dip bars. Excellent quality all around. My only issue, the instructions can be made a little easier to decipher, and the nuts, bolts, and washers could be better labeled in their own separate pouches. If there are any later issues, I'll do a later re-comment, but for right now, it's serving me very well. Very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should have written a 5-star review for this years ago ...
customer_reviews.text: Should have written a 5-star review for this years ago. I have 2 Stamina power towers and they have always been reliable and safe, although I have never pushed the boundaries in terms of safety. I have stuck to pull ups, chin ups, and dips.
customer_reviews.author: Drunkfrombud90

customer_reviews.title: Assembly steps were simple but it was painful when it came to tightening the hex screws
customer_reviews.text: Assembly steps were simple but it was painful when it came to tightening the hex screws. My hands were writhing in pain from tightening them as best I could and even then it doesn't feel like they are as tight as they can be. When I get to the top of my pull-ups, it's sturdy enough that I know it won't fall down but there is a slight wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Petix

customer_reviews.title: Solid product at reasonable cost, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice and solid unit. I read many reviews about the product being wobbly before purchasing the unit, but my unit feels very solid like a single welded unit. Only issue I had was the plastic spacer blocks which weren't designed to take pressure - two of the four spacer blocks cracked while tightening the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: BD11371

customer_reviews.title: A solid unit at a great price, you will not regret purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I have this product is three years, assembled for those three years. Truth be told, I have only begun to use it for the past year. I have been using that at least four times a week for the last 52 weeks, about 50 chin up or pull ups are done on those workout days? I weigh about 185 pounds and stand 5'9". I have been very satisfied with this product. It is just as sturdy as the day it was assembled and all bolts are still strongly and securely in place. I would have no reservations in recommending this unit to anyone as I am completely satisfied with my current Tower and the price I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sharkey

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Easy to put together. Arrived quickly. Makes a good coat rack when you give up after the first month. Buy the stretch resistance bands. They definitely help.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: a great stand. Look
customer_reviews.text: For the money, a great stand. Look, if you work at it, you can get this to tip over, but if you are using it as intended it works great. Our whole family ranging from 180 - 90 lbs uses this constantly, and even the neighbor kids. We've had lots of pull-up contests. My husband likes to pop on and do pull-ups every morning and night. Also doubles to air dry my clothes, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Slightly Above Average
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy! It took about 40 min with limited tools by someone who never assembles anything. It is relatively sturdy. I'm a 200lbs regular at the gym. It doesn't feel like it'll collapse but if I swing my body a little too much, it may tip. Overall, it is a descent buy for the price! In retrospect, I'd probably spend the extra $50 or w.e. and buy a sturdier one with a back/ arm rest. Bottom line, if you're looking for something similar to the gym, you'll be disappointed. But if you're just looking for some home equipment, that you'll occasionally use, this is the right buy for you!
customer_reviews.author: Sean S.

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles. Very restrictive.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t really use the pull up bar. Back padding far to small. Hits lower back in a painful way. Very wobbly. Even used impact wrench to put together. Still wobbles like crazy. Worth 59.95 but not what it’s selling for on amazon. Not a complete waste but regret buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: S V

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not rated for 250 lbs, Tips over on pullups
customer_reviews.text: Almost tips over when my 90lb son does chin ups. Sure he swings a little bit getting up there, but come on, if this is rated for 250 lbs, surely it can handle a 90 lb boy. I have to stand on the other side to counter balance it so he can do his chin ups. There is no way that this is a 250 lb weight limit. Maybe for pushups and muscle ups, but definitely not chin ups or pull ups. If not for the tipping factor, I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 7 year old (gymnast) son. He has really enjoyed using it! He utilizes it for chin-ups, swinging, hanging, and grip training. He isn't quite big enough to use it for push-ups just yet, butvdoes for sit-ups. My husband also can use it without issue, but with caution. He is 6'2 about 225lbs and it does get wobbly on him. Overall, awesome product! 5-stars for kids but 4-stars for larger adults based on stability.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBoyde

customer_reviews.title: It does its job, although it's slightly wobbly. ...
customer_reviews.text: It does its job, although it's slightly wobbly. I will admit I'm 6'4" 230lbs, so I'm testing its limits. The plastic spacers which separate the dip handles' vertical bar and the Pull-up vertical bar ALL shattered upon installation (all 4 of them). I was not over-tightening or doing anything incorrectly. I used the thickness of a 2X4 scraps to fill in the gap, rather than any plastic spacer. The wood is more forgiving and shatter-proof.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Sturdy for all types. My young daughters love to climb on it, I use it comfortably at 5'3 130, and my husband, 5'9 200, is comfortable on it as well. Attach hanging rings on top bar for other exercises as well. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: kara osborne escalante

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need!
customer_reviews.text: Guess what?!?! This product came in perfect condition. Was extremely easy to put together. Is cheap and doesn't take up any room at all!! Comes with all the tools you'll need AND is very sturdy my brother is around 240 or 260lb's and he did some dips and pull ups and it was perfectly fine. :) Great for a day when you can't make it to the gym or just like to work out at home.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan G. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Overall, nice. Some minor stability issues.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 2 months. Use 2-3/x per week. 6’ 180 lbs and this is fairly sturdy. As other have noted, a little wobbly on dips. Go slow and problem is mitigated. Could be improved with iso pull-up grips and a more angled pull-up bar. Otherwise, lots of exercises possible and comfortable grips. Would definitely recommend having 2 people put together, especially last 3-4 bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Aram B

customer_reviews.title: so good. Found the power tower to be easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Found the power tower to be easy to assemble. Maybe 25-30 minutes to construct on my own. Everything lined up perfectly and tightened easily. The only concern would be for the top 2 bolts that connect the pull up bar, while tightening I felt like I could have easily stripped them from over tightening. Seems sturdy enough for my 190 lbs and high enough for my 5' 9" height. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anthony Junkas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, seems to be high quality material. The only questionable components to this is the plastic spacers (4) one of them developed a crack. I recommend not overly tightening the bolts that pass through the spacers. I would take away a star, but for the price, what you get is a great value. I feel safe doing pull ups on this, and that's what matters most to me!
customer_reviews.author: NickG

customer_reviews.title: VERY PLEASED.
customer_reviews.text: Have put this up to do my chin-up routine and it works great. Very stable and strong. Took about an hour for me alone to assemble. Recently ordered a "step-up" strap from eBay so I can reach the bar more easily. I am 5'10" and need to be far above the floor for the routine I do. I was using a chair to step up and grab onto the bar, but it was inconvenient. Recommend this and think the price is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mary

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve only used it a couple of times so far but we love it. It seems well built and the bolts are made out of strong metal. It made a great Christmas present and was fairly easy to assemble. I wish the directions were a little more detailed. ie. which way the middle bar should face and how tight to make the bolts. Other than that it seems great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret B.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I just finished putting it together. Like others have said, use your own socket wrench. I have to give it 4 stars because one of the foam grips is torn a little bit. I'm 6'4" and 250 pounds and it seems to be able to hold my weight well so far. *UPDATE* I have owned this for over a year, and I still love it. It has held up very well! Some people complain about it wobbling....well, do pull-ups the right way, and don't swing. I'm increasing my rating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rose

customer_reviews.title: do it
customer_reviews.text: I dont review often but i am really enjoying this unit. did a ton of research on all similar power bars, this one is easy to put together and as stable as any of these sub $400 power towers could be. wife and I use it. arms are not too far apart for tri dips. glad i went with this one. for the money- its a bargain
customer_reviews.author: amazoneverything

customer_reviews.title: Very solid product
customer_reviews.text: Simple and effective. Really sturdy, well made tower, that actually has some solid bulk to it. I love using this tower because you can achieve a serious workout very quickly. I'm 5'10", 160 lbs and this tower handles my dimensions easily. I flipped the dip bars to face same way as the push up bars and pull up bar, so I could push one side of the tower legs under a bed. Takes up less room in my spare bedroom this way. The change of arrangement seems to make no difference in the balance of the tower.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Solid, holding up well under a lot of use. Pleasantly surprised by this one. I have to admit that I had very low expectations for this product. However, so far I love the thing and so do my teenagers. Have only had it a few days, so I reserve the right to complain later. It does the job and seems to be pretty decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this regularly since the quarantine and has been extremely pleased with it. Good value, doesn’t take up too much room, easy to move.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for pull-ups and chin ups(no kip).
customer_reviews.text: Too narrow for pushups. Dip bars are way too wide. It’s a bit flimsy standing on its own so I hang two 35 lb kettle bells on each dip handle. I can kip with the extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Karma

customer_reviews.title: Decent Tower, A Little Shaky
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off with the assembly. The directions for the assembly were pretty good but it would be much easier with two people. I did it by myself in a couple of hours. I am no handy-man so that could attribute to the amount of time it took me. You will need a 17mm socket to complete secure assembly. Not the most sturdy piece of equipment. It is pretty shaky.The pull-up bar is comfortable, which is nice. I will never use the push-up handles but the dip handles and pull-up bar are pretty comfortable. If it was not so shaky I would give it more stars. I will meet my needs for a part of my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: The1AndOnlyWay

customer_reviews.title: Good Equipment
customer_reviews.text: I use it almost every day, Im 6'1" and 220 pounds and I crank out push ups and pull ups like a champ on this, does not feel flimsy, was easy to put together and it works. Don't do muscle ups or crazy cross fit pull ups on it and you will be fine, its solid glad I picked it up.
customer_reviews.author: Marko S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product but bigger than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I was kind of surprised at how big the machine was in real life. It spans about 32 inches by 48 inches on the floor. I'm 120 pounds and can swing hanging on to the bars without it being wobbly. I also put it together in 45 mins alone, but I would suggest having a helper to avoid all the bruises =D. Looking at the pictures is enough to piece it together. Very important! don't tighten the bolts until the end cause I had to loosen some to fit the spacer tubes in. Just tighten it a little if you are worried about it falling apart midway.
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: Great upper body workout
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first and almost canceled the item before delivery. I was afraid it might be too flimsy. Wow, I am glad I didn't. It is made out of solid steel and is very sturdy. Set up took "some" effort, but was definitely worth it. I am getting good upper body workout and my 7 and 9-year-old boys love to play on this as well??? They are doing push ups on their own! :)
customer_reviews.author: Tae Lim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Anyone Under 6 Foot!!!!
customer_reviews.text: About Me: Male, 175 pounds, 5' 11" Intended Use: Pull-ups, Tricep Dips Pros: Great Price Very Sturdy Nearly Zero Wobble Compact Size Great Size, No Needed To Bend Cons: Needed Ratchet For Assembly (The Ones They Give Take Forever)
customer_reviews.author: THEMAN

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really a 2-person job to assemble. Otherwise, you have to prop pieces up against a wall or furniture. I'm 6'1" and weigh about 170lbs. If you plan to do pull-ups quickly or in rapid succession, then prepare yourself. This tower is very easy to tip over. To stabilize, I would recommend placing some heavy dumbbells or sandbags on the base of the tower.
customer_reviews.author: iRunner

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile equipment for your garage gym!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and you are able to perform a bunch of different exercises on it. In order not to tilt, I bought 4 bags of sand at my local home depot and placed them at the bottom of tower, over each of the legs. They work great! After a month of so of using it consistently, I had a small issue with the grip on the pull up bar, the company send me a new bar with a new grip. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Mondrany

customer_reviews.title: So far it is great. I purchased this for p90x3 pull ups because ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it is great. I purchased this for p90x3 pull ups because we just bought a house that has doorways too thick for a pull up bar. It arrived in good shape. I put it together in about a half hour. Recommend socket wrench instead of included manual wrenches. It is solid. I don't feel like it may break at any time, unlike the doorway pull up bar I used at our previous house. The dip bar and pushup bar are bonuses, in that I only bought it for pullups. It is pretty huge sitting in our front room. It needs two people to move around. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Not Tall Enough for all Movements
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for basic pull ups and dips. For pull ups you have to bend your knees if you are on the taller side. I am not sure if this is the right product for a full body extension clever or any other gymnastic moves. Also not sure if it is the best product for weighted excersizes. For these reasons I have given it an average rating.
customer_reviews.author: tzander

customer_reviews.title: Not made for much use
customer_reviews.text: I got it a couple years ago and never really got around to using it but I’m the last three weeks I’ve used it daily and it seems that the bolt for the pull up bar stripped out the internal threading so it can’t be used anymore. Cheaply made I suppose. I’m about 195lbs so I didn’t expect it to ever fail.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Pull up Tower
customer_reviews.text: This is solid and a good value. The sit up feature is a nice bonus as it puts you in the proper position, and it does not wobble during use. I have an 84" clearance to the beams in my basement and this fits. I placed it so that my head fits between the beams during the pull up, which gives me an extra 6 inches. The dips are no concern for head clearance. I'm 6'2 and 180 lbs
customer_reviews.author: krmason

customer_reviews.title: Renter friendly pull-ups!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have work out gloves, but the padding makes it almost unnecessary! Assembly isn't too bad either. If you have ever put together other items, this one shouldn't be too bad. Looking at a picture of what it is supposed to look like and reading the instructions should be enough. I have used it every day since it arrived and so far, I love it. I weigh 175lbs and I have not had any problems with it not staying in place. I do leg raises and swings and dips and everything, and it does not show any sign of movement. I do use it on carpet, though.
customer_reviews.author: TheNL

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite things ever!
customer_reviews.text: If you're the type of person who suddenly gets the urge to wrestle with something and you don't have a cat or unwitting boyfriend on hand, this is awesome. I got the purple WODFitters band for pull-up assistance. The tower went together easily, maybe 15 minutes. The finish is a bit delicate, but the foam pads seem pretty OK. I hesitated to buy this because I really, really wanted parallel pull-up bars, but there's a lot else that you can do with this and the price is very reasonable. I'd recommend buying it without much deliberation.
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: Love this power tower!
customer_reviews.text: After looking at many different power towers before buying, this is the one I decided on, and I have not been disappointed. It is very sturdy, and I find that the distance between the handles are perfect for my needs, close enough to include plenty of arm with the torso in my push and pull exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Tom J

customer_reviews.title: Put weights or sand bag for it not to sway
customer_reviews.text: I have to buy the US Weight Deluxe Eco-Canopy Weights with Carry Strap - 40 lb because it moves when i try sway when im doing my pull up.. Im planning to do a muscle up but yeah. I have it installed by a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Stresh.us

customer_reviews.title: 4/5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product, the only thing about it is that I find it a little too light. I fixed this by putting sandbags at the bottom, but before that I found that is wasn't quite stable enough for me to do muscle-ups. For pull-ups, chin-ups, dips, etc. it was perfect right from the get-go, just for muscle-ups it wasn't as sturdy as I would have liked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would have loved to have tried it out.
customer_reviews.text: Would have loved to have tried this. It shows up. I unpack it. No hardware for assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L Melton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, stellar value.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Assembled quickly alone and half awake using tools provided, if your hands are easily pained the included tools will hurt, but I'm a grease monkey with turtle shells for palms and didn't mind torquing it to roughly 8nm gloveless on all but the 10mm fasteners. I'm 191 lbs and 5'10", and it handled pullups with kipping with no shudders or shifts, the thing is truly solid and well built. It looks good, I have noticed nothing near a glaring defect or cosmetic gripe worth arguing against the unbelievably fair price point. Snag one, I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Wurfel

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks of use I'm happy with it. No major complaints. Wrenches are supplied in package but if you have a 10, 13 and 17mm socket or box wrench (two each) setup will be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great as you can use this little thing for SO many exercises! I'm an acrobat and I needed a way to work out during this weird time. I love this tower as I'm able to fully use every part of it and stay in shape!
customer_reviews.author: CorrieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tower for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good tower! I never had one, but its helped me go from 0 to 10 pullups in roughly a month. It's stable and has a nice feel. However, doing shoulder grip pullups are a bit awkward with the foam literally stopping right at the area your hands need to go. Great besides that.
customer_reviews.author: TooTired

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pros It's put together with 14 bolts, 12 nuts, and 26 washers; a breeze. I can do all the exercises this product allows correctly; I'm 6' and weigh 220#s. It makes the cross-fit "chin-for-volume" crowd look silly because they tip over the device with their improper form. Cons The wrenches it comes with are useless with the larger bolts and nuts. The dip grips were both damaged, but not enough for me to return it. I use this through out the day, everyday. I usually do a couple of dips/chins/push-ups every half hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Me

customer_reviews.title: Great value high quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value that is easy to assemble. It took me about 40 minutes or so to assemble. The only issue is that it is fairly tall and when you do a pull up your head may hit the ceiling if you do not have enough clearance. Consider the product height but also add space for your pull ups. Generally this is a great product and excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: I am a Personal Trainer and wanted to have something ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a Personal Trainer and wanted to have something at Home to augment working out that does Not involve driving back to the Gym on my days off. After the hellacious New England winter of last year, I decided to buy this and have been using it for about 4 weeks now. I am 5 `10 and a solid 182 and do every single exercise, including adding weights to my body for pull ups and dips.....and it is stable and confidence building. By doing some Fitness Work at home, this Reinforces the most important aspect of all......the Fitness Habit. Keep it visible and not hidden away and you will actually Use it.
customer_reviews.author: Libro  Addicto

customer_reviews.title: a true quality product
customer_reviews.text: A really quality product. Heavy, stable and allows me to do the exercises I had hoped it would: chin ups, pull ups, and dips. It also has a station for sit ups which I don't use as I have other ways I exercise my stomach. Yes, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, but not easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money. If you’re comfortable with bodyweight training, this machine is all you need. It’s great for chin-ups, push-ups, sit-ups and dips. However, it was definitely NOT easy to assemble - millions of screws, nuts and washers of different sizes. Unless you’re a DIY warrior, hire a friendly handyman to assist.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't my first choice but has been great!
customer_reviews.text: My first choice power tower was going to take another month to arrive, so I ordered this one hoping it would suffice. I'm 240 lbs and wanted something I could do pullups on. This one has no problem with my weight and is very steady. I don't think I would have been happier with my first choice tower.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and excellent price. Easy to assemble, but needs two people for it to be fast and simple. I only wish it would be 3 inches taller, so i wouldn't have to bend my knees when doing pull ups, but it's not a big deal. It feels sturdy and the finishing is nice. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy going to work my up slowly to as many pull ups as I can do. I'm 64 and and been using for 2 weeks with other weight training and already showing some good bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: Four upper body exercises in one affordable piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tower for my office, and I really like it. At home I have a more expensive pull-up stand but this one is more stable, because of its long front to back footprint. Also I really like the dip handles and the full range of motion pushup handles (allows deeper push-up). In addition the push-up handles will be easier on those with painful wrists. Another benefit is the little step allows you to jump into the up position for negative pull-ups and chin-ups if you are too tired or weak to complete them from the down position.
customer_reviews.author: Therealgoodhurt

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Thing product has everything you are asking for. A pull up bar, dip section, a unnecessary push up section. It really is reasonably sturdy. I am a 230 lb individual who uses this product a lot and it is plenty strong. Might give a little here and there but its reasonable movement I think designed to protect the frame. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 220 lbs and this thing is awesome! So sturdy. I can do chin-ups, sit-ups ect and not worry about bending or breaking the bars. Much better than a doorway chin-up bar!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good quality great price
customer_reviews.text: Assemble perty easy might need a second person for some parts. As for the pull ups i was skeptical at first thing it would not be sturdy but i was wrong it stable and strong even if you swing a bit. Im only 160 bit perty sure it can handle more no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Good for deadhang Pull-ups and varying grips
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and affordable. Good grip. Flexes a little which forces you to not kip because you would unbalance it - deadhang pull-ups are a better workout but your numbers go down 15-20%. Best thing is that you can vary the grip more than traditional pull-up bars. Definitely recommend it over a doorway pull-up bar.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but takes up lots of space
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to use an over the door frame pull-up bar, so I got this for my P90X workouts. It's annoying to put together with the hex wrench that comes with it, but ultimately gets the job done. It feels sturdy and is great for workouts, but it does take up a bit of space. I wish you could fold it to stow it away more easily.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two months ago. Assembling was fairly straight forward. Light but solid. If you are taller than 5' 7" which is my height, you will need to bend your legs not to touch ground. Overall I am happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: H.D. KWON

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid for the money. Wish the pullup bar was larger diameter. At 1in in diameter, not comfortable for large hands. Don't care for the padding that is ripping off anyways with use.
customer_reviews.author: Mazinga

customer_reviews.title: Good device
customer_reviews.text: Grandson,age 14, can not do much in the way of pull ups/push ups. This device appears to be helping him get stronger. Simple to put together. Still sitting in living room as it is in view all the time. He will do a little exercise each time he comes by it. Hopefully it will help in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: rowdy yates

customer_reviews.title: Great equipment
customer_reviews.text: Hubby likes it for when he can’t get to the gym and has to get a quick workout in. It’s a bit on the large side which is what you’d expect for workout equipment but that’s my only con. It takes up so much space in our closet.
customer_reviews.author: CnS4EVA

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and pretty well made
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and pretty well made. I am 5' 10'', 170-175lbs and don't have any problems with the stability of the equipment. One problem I do have is that the supports that hold the top bar in place grab the bar right where I naturally need to put my hands.This results in some slightly awkward pull ups/chin ups and hurt my technique a little. I do have pretty wide shoulders which is why it is a problem for me I am guessing. Would have been 5 stars if not for that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pull up/dip station under $200 that would support a tall person over 200lbs (6'4 210). I decided on the stamina 1690 based on reviews here on Amazon, Reddit, and YouTube. It arrived today, and I think I made a good choice. So far it feels very sturdy. There is some wobble, but 1/2 of it is probably my muscles as I haven't done dips in awhile. It definitely feels sturdy, and I'll update my review after I get a few workouts in.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Carter

customer_reviews.title: for which this is perfect. If I am quickly doing pull ups it ...
customer_reviews.text: 160lb 5'9" male. I have had this for a year and do pull ups/dips with it regularly. I can manage pull ups without hitting my head on a standard height ceiling. I also tend to do slow controlled movements, for which this is perfect. If I am quickly doing pull ups it tends to rock a bit but I have never felt like it would fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Will Beeler

customer_reviews.title: It is Affordable
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gym equipment money can buy. Because it is AFFORDABLE! It is very sturdy and easy to set up. I purchased it for doing dips but I find myself using it more on push ups. I weight 180lbs so it supports me well when i do the Pull ups. A friend of mine tried it with the Pull ups and he weighs 210lbs and it still managed to be stable with him. If your like me and dont want to pay for those expensive gym memberships and do allot of work out with body weight, I highly recommend this. Also for the price it is a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: weselyd

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It was easy to put together by ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It was easy to put together by myself. It did take some time to get everything tightened up so that it would be wobbly, but now it feels very stable. I only wish I could get a slightly wider neutral grip without going into a wide grip. My shoulder width grip is exactly where the top is bolted into the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Like I imagined, I don't want it no more after a month
customer_reviews.text: A bundle of iron pipes. Doesn't have that solid and sturdy feel. Cheapens the experience of working out.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: The station wobbles A LOT if you aren't perfect at doing pullups
customer_reviews.text: The station wobbles A LOT if you aren't perfect at doing pullups. . It is good enough for the price but the foam started coming off within a couple weeks. Overall I would recommend to go with a higher budgeted item but if this is max for your price range you will be able to get results with this station
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential workout piece
customer_reviews.text: Looks clean, is sturdy and has a small footprint compared to most at-home workout systems. It went together without too much trouble. We have it in our basement, which has tall ceilings. Words to the wise: sure to check the height of the ceiling against the height of this tower, and know that it's tricky to move through doorways once assembled.
customer_reviews.author: NCBean

customer_reviews.title: Great for pullups/tricep dips. A little wobbly though.
customer_reviews.text: I workout a lot but decided going to the gym was too pricey so I got this. Overall, it's a great piece of equipment. I'm ~180lbs, so I'm nearing the threshold limit. That said 1) Works great for pullups in different forms. Overall pretty stable, although does wobble if you yourself have lazy form and swing around 2) Great for tricep dips. Almost no wobbling at all 3) Pushups are okay, the poles seem to get loose My only complaint is that the screws seem to come loose if you use it heavily (~4 times a week). The pushup bars don't stay in place and shift when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Poe

customer_reviews.title: Takes a small space
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I finally can do chin ups in my bedroom. I’m 6’ft and 200 pounds it wiggles a little bit when my form is bad but I don’t see that as a bad thing. It helps me to optimize my form. When it’s not wiggling or shaking I know my form is good.
customer_reviews.author: marvo21

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this item. The picture doesn't quite do it justice if you're not familiar with it. In person, it is certainly thicker and more sturdy than I had imagined from the picture. It is very solid and should handle my weight of 150 pounds or more with no problems. I am also very pleased that it fits in my basement with enough headroom for head clearance when I do a full pull-up. I purchased this to do with the Beachbody Body Beast weight lifting program. At $99.00 including shipping thanks to Amazon prime, I think this is an excellent deal.
customer_reviews.author: VoyageAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for improving my workouts
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It's really stepped up my workouts. It's so easy to assemble, I did it while on crutches by myself. There are a lot of great videos on a huge variety of ways to utilize this equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Chad A Hildebran

customer_reviews.title: Best value for your money and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Super easy to setup, I did it on my own. Great for calisthenics, I added the gymnastics rings to this for my home setup. For regular movements it's pretty sturdy and solid. I do a lot of ab lifts to the side, where the stand tends to sway very slightly, but holds strong. I do a lot of offset style pull ups and the stand sways at that point to a little more, but again still holds. For the price, this is a worthwhile buy. You can do a lot of exercises with it and a great beginner to advanced setup.
customer_reviews.author: Arjit Purohit

product_meta.title: Stamina Power Towers
product_meta.description: Stamina Power Towers are an ideal, all-in-one solution for building (or maintaining) the sculpted physique you desire through bodyweight training. Bodyweight training is a proven way to build muscle, burn fat and tone the upper and lower body. The compact, vertical design and multiple use stations make power towers efficient and versatile for many different bodyweight movements. Many of our power towers include the capability for exercises like pull-ups, tricep dips, push-ups, sit-ups, knee raises and more.
feature_bullets: WHY POWER TOWER? Power Towers allow for many different bodyweight exercises, helping you lose weight, build muscle and improve heart health. Bodyweight routines are invigorating and effective for major muscle groups.
ALL-IN-ONE FITNESS EQUIPMENT: The versatile Stamina Power Tower 1690 can be used for pull-ups, dips, push-ups, chin-ups, sit-ups, vertical knee raises and more.
STABLE AND COMFORTABLE: Secure foam hand grips at each exercise station provide stability and comfort during exercise. The durable steel frame supports users of up to 250 lbs.

FITS MANY SPACES: After an easy assembly, the Stamina Power Tower 1690 is a compact tower, making it ideal for any indoor or garage space. Non-slip endcaps protect whatever surface the Power Tower may rest on.
WARRANTY INCLUDED: Comes with 5-year frame and 90 day parts warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
